t: Isaiah 22
Proclamation Against Jerusalem
The*p burden against the Valley of Vision. What*pn ails you now, that you have all gone up to the housetops,
You*ld who are full of noise, A*ld tumultuous city, a joyous city? Your*ld slain men*i are*i not slain with the sword, Nor*ld dead in battle.
All*ld your rulers have fled together; They*ld are captured by the archers. All*ld who are found in you are bound together; They*ld have fled from afar.
Therefore*ld I said, “Look away from me, I*ld will weep bitterly; Do*ld not labor to comfort me Because*ld of the plundering of the daughter of my people.”
For*ln it*i is*i a day of trouble and treading down and perplexity By*ld the Lord God*s of hosts In*ld the Valley of Vision— Breaking*ld down the walls And*ld of crying to the mountain.
Elam*ld bore the quiver With*ld chariots of men and*i horsemen, And*ld Kir uncovered the shield.
It*ld shall come to pass that*i your choicest valleys Shall*ld be full of chariots, And*ld the horsemen shall set themselves in array at the gate.
He*ln removed the protection of Judah. You*ld looked in that day to the armor of the House of the Forest;
You*ld also saw the damage to the city of David, That*ld it was great; And*ld you gathered together the waters of the lower pool.
You*ld numbered the houses of Jerusalem, And*ld the houses you broke down To*ld fortify the wall.
You*ld also made a reservoir between the two walls For*ld the water of the old pool. But*ld you did not look to its Maker, Nor*ld did you have respect for Him who fashioned it long ago.
And*ln in that day the Lord God*s of hosts Called*ld for weeping and for mourning, For*ld baldness and for girding with sackcloth.
But*ld instead, joy and gladness, Slaying*ld oxen and killing sheep, Eating*ld meat and drinking wine: “Let*ld us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die!”
Then*ln it was revealed in my hearing by the Lord*s of hosts, “Surely*ld for this iniquity there will be no atonement for you, Even*ld to your death,” says the Lord God*s of hosts.
The Judgment on Shebna
Thus*p says the Lord God*s of hosts: “Go,*pn proceed to this steward, To*ld Shebna, who is*i over the house, and*i say:*i
‘What*ld have you here, and whom have you here, That*ld you have hewn a sepulcher here, As*ild he who hews himself a sepulcher on high, Who*ld carves a tomb for himself in a rock?
Indeed,*ld the Lord*s will throw you away violently, O*ld mighty man, And*ld will surely seize you.
He*ld will surely turn violently and toss you like a ball Into*ld a large country; There*ld you shall die, and there your glorious chariots Shall*ild be*i the shame of your master’s house.
So*ld I will drive you out of your office, And*ld from your position he will pull you down.
‘Then*ln it shall be in that day, That*ld I will call My servant Eliakim the son of Hilkiah;

I*ld will clothe him with your robe And*ld strengthen him with your belt; I*ld will commit your responsibility into his hand. He*ld shall be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem And*ld to the house of Judah.
The*ld key of the house of David I*ld will lay on his shoulder; So*ld he shall open, and no one shall shut; And*ld he shall shut, and no one shall open.
I*ld will fasten him as*i a peg in a secure place, And*ld he will become a glorious throne to his father’s house.
‘They*p will hang on him all the glory of his father’s house, the offspring and the posterity, all vessels of small quantity, from the cups to all the pitchers.

In that day,’ says the Lord*s of hosts, ‘the peg that is fastened in the secure place will be removed and be cut down and fall, and the burden that was*i on it will be cut off; for the Lord*s has spoken.’”
